metadata.title: CVE-2019-17010 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
Under certain conditions, when checking the Resist Fingerprintingpreference during device orientation checks, a race condition could havecaused a use-after-free and a potentially exploitable crash. Thisvulnerability affects Thunderbird < 68.3, Firefox ESR < 68.3, and Firefox <71.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-17010` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 71.0+build5-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '71.0+build5-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
